documentation.text: @notice Only allows functions to be executed where the sender matches the authorizedRelayer address

@notice Sets the `authorizedOracle` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls
 @param _authorizedOracle The new address to authorize as the oracle

@notice Sets the `authorizedRelayer` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls
 @param _authorizedRelayer The new address to authorize as the oracle
@title XChainEndpoint. The full contract (inherits from all contracts above) that interfaces with all cross-chain interactions

documentation.text:
@notice Notifies the Oracle that the current block contains Zorro cross chain transactions
 @dev Meant to be called internally by the Contract layer

@notice Callback function for notifyOracle. Receives callback from Chainlink node after oracle job is run
 @param _blockNumber The number of the block that was recorded by the Oracle in the notifyOracle() call

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params._authorizedOracle: The new address to authorize as the oracle

params._authorizedRelayer: The new address to authorize as the oracle

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

setAuthorizedOracle(address).notice: Sets the `authorizedOracle` address to a new address. This is designed to allow only a certain address to make calls
